intro: Descurainia menziesii var. ochroleuca, commonly known as the yellow-flowered tansy mustard, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately divided, and covered in fine hairs. The yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators.
